function.description:
Returns a floating point number between 0 (no likeness) and 1 (identical), indicating how similar the `source` and `target` are.
This routine uses the Damereau Levenshtein distance to calculate the similarity. If `relative` is set to `false`, then the absolute distance will be returned rather than a relative distance.

example.title: Usage
example.code:
use System, String;
System.print(String.wordDistance("boy", "boy")); // 1 System.print(String.wordDistance("boy", "boys")); // 0.75 System.print(String.wordDistance("boys", "girl")); // 0 System.print(String.wordDistance("girls", "girlfriends")); // 0.4545454545454546 System.print(String.wordDistance("girls", "girlfriends", false)); // 6
